attributes.action: prevent legislation coming into force preventing persons under the age of 18 taking a driving test and holding a full driving license, whilst preserving the current legislation in place and keeping the minimum driving age at 17.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Proposals to force young people to wait until the age of 18 to take a driving test are unacceptable. The Prime Minister should not back any proposals to increase the age at which young people can take their test and hold a full UK driving license to 18 whilst being able to drive under supervision from the age of 17. Not only will this be costly for those who wish to learn whilst 17 as insurance premiums are higher for provisional licenses but it also inhibits the freedom of those who wish to drive. However the undersigned to back a minimum amount of driving hours before taking a test and a more rigourous curriculum to be followed whilst learning to drive to promote safety in qualified drivers.
